alert.note: Alert for Logan; Mason (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 2:31PM CST until February 22 at 5:15PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, De Witt, Logan, Mason and Menard. In west central Illinois, Cass, Morgan and Schuyler. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 229 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since early this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area through 430 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Beardstown, Mason City, Virginia, Petersburg, Atlanta, Bluff Springs, Greenview, Chandlerville, Waynesville, Arenzville, Middletown, Hartsburg, Kilbourne, Browning, Oakford, New Holland, Frederick, Lawndale and Newmansville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
